result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carnelius C-Angelo Burks

records.addlTxt: Defendant missed court on 10/27/22.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 11/7/22 at 8:30 am, in Branch 29.  Parties notified.

Defendant Carnelius C-Angelo Burks not in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Carnelius C-Angelo Burks.  Attorney Ryan Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Carnelius C-Angelo Burks appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Carnelius C-Angelo Burks.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defendant has a new pending matter. Case is adjourned for a scheduling conference in Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-26-2022, filed.

Defendant Carnelius C-Angelo Burks appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Carnelius C-Angelo Burks.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carnelius C-Angelo Burks in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-19-2022, filed.

Defendant Carnelius C Burks in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference to Br 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver, filed.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 07-26-2022

Defendant Carnelius C Burks in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Status Conference held. Defense Counsel was recently appointed and requests a Preliminary Hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 07-01-2022, filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 06-23-2022, filed.

Defendant Carnelius C Burks in court with attorney Thomas Reed, as a friend of the court.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Attorney Reed provides an update to the Court. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Court sets matter for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 06-10-2022, filed.

Defendant Carnelius C Burks in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with T.D-M
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Carnelius C Burks in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Carnelius C Burks in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carnelius C Burks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
